chineseMeaning: adj. 光辉的;灿烂的;
adj. 平等主义的; n. 平等主义者;
examples: I am lways in an egalitarian stance.

chineseMeaning: adj. 灵活的;有弹性的;可变的; n. 橡皮圈;有松紧的东西;
examples: The new policy was sufficiently elastic to accommodate both views.
This swimming costume is made of elastic material.
The slacks have an elastic waistband.

chineseMeaning: v. 加强;增强;筑防御工事于;（物质或精神上）支持或鼓励;
examples: They decided to fortify the coastal areas.
This country will fortify the coastal areas.
Tungsten is used to fortify steel for cars.
They fortify the dam against the flood.
The medieval town is fortified with a high wall and a deep moat.
Good eating habits help to fortify the body against disease.

chineseMeaning: n. 创立者; v. 摔倒;失败;沉没;弄跛;
examples: He is the founder of the party.
He was the founder of this society.

chineseMeaning: n. 破碎;骨折; vt. 破碎;破裂; vi. 断裂;
examples: A fellow team member says it was a clean fracture without complications.
He had several injuries, including three fractures.

chineseMeaning: n. 发酵剂;酵母;要素;影响力; v. 使 ... 发酵;影响;
examples: We often use leaven when baking breads.
The leaven of reform was working.

chineseMeaning: adj. 机敏的;有戒心的;留神的;
adj. 宽大的;仁慈的;
examples: Most of the others appealed against their life prison sentences with death, hoping for more lenient ones.

chineseMeaning: vt. 操纵;操作;控制;利用;(巧妙地)处理;篡改;
examples: A clever politician know how to manipulate public opinion.
He is one of those who manipulate the market.
Do you know how to manipulate a computer ?
She uses her charm to manipulate people.
She uses her charm to manipulate people.
A clever politician knows how to manipulate his public opinion.
With special lenses and prisms we can manipulate this light.
The treasurer was arrested for trying to manipulate the company's accounts.

chineseMeaning: vt. 解放(奴隶);
vt. 破坏;毁坏; n. 污点;瑕疵; abbr. 海上的（=maritime）;  Mar.; abbr. 三月（March）;
examples: This will mar the beauty of your hair.
Nothing had occurred to mar this trip.
Nothing happened to mar the old man's happiness.
His handling of the crisis can make or mar his career.
If he does not break himself of his bad habit, he will mar his own market.
Such a mistake would mar your career.
Age cannot mar her beauty.

chineseMeaning: n. 严格执行纪律的人;严格的人;
examples: Our dean is an understanding counselor, not a martinet.
They discover that the new teacher is a martinet.

chineseMeaning: n. 游牧部落一员;流浪者;
examples: The nomads have no habitation.
Most of the nomads live in grassland and have no fixed home.
He was indeed a nomad of no nationality.

chineseMeaning: adj. 若无其事的;不关心的;冷淡的;
examples: "It'll be fine," she replied, with a nonchalant shrug.
He immediately remarked with the most nonchalant air.
She defeated all her rivals for the job with nonchalant ease.
His nonchalant attitude irritated me.

chineseMeaning: n. 无专长或成就的人;不存在的事物;
examples: How could such a nonentity become chairman of the company?
And talking is always difficult to catch owing to its nonentity.

chineseMeaning: vt. 使具备资格;描述;[语]修饰; vi. 取得资格;合格;
examples: This test will qualify you to fly an aircraft.
His knowledge and skills qualify him for the job.
Your passport qualifies you to receive free medical treatment.
I qualify it as a plot.
Adverbs are always used to qualify verbs.

chineseMeaning: n. 隔离;检疫期间;封锁交通;四十天; vt. 检疫;停止交涉; vi. 检疫;
examples: Quarantine restriction have been lifted on import animal from that country.
He had been kept in quarantine for a week.

chineseMeaning: v. 镇压;撤销;平息;
examples: The army was called in to quash the revolt.
The applicant sought judicial review to quash the order.
The appeal court quashed the care order made by the juvenile court.
I was about to learn how to quash hunger.
Growth, translated into jobs, is designed to quash the risk of social instability.

chineseMeaning: vt. 压制;平息;消除;减轻;
examples: Soldiers were sent in to quell the riots.
The armed force had to be called out to quell violence.
His actio have done little to quell the eculation.
The police have been called in to quell a minor disturbance.
Difficulties and setbacks never quell their curiosity.
The government's reassurances have done nothing to quell the doubts of the public.
This medicine will quell your sore throat.

chineseMeaning: v. 退却;畏缩;弹回;报应; n. 畏缩;弹回;后坐力;
examples: She recoiled at the sight of the snake.
A gun recoils after being fired.
Plots sometimes recoil on the plotters.

chineseMeaning: adj. 深奥的;难解的;隐藏的;
examples: Gene research is a recondite area of learning.

chineseMeaning: v. 重组;使恢复原状;
examples: The board of directors of the firm has been reconstituted recently.
We decided to reconstitute the committee under a new chairman.
Use warm water to reconstitute dried milk powder.
Every day she reconstitutes the frozen orange juice by adding water.
